title: ICC – cell culture–cell line staining (35mm dish)
author: Nosov G.

materials.text: bungarotoxin – stock solution: 1µg/1µl (488 Alexa – green or TRITC – red), dilute 1:1000 in appropriate media used for the cell culture (final concentration 5µg/1ml)
fixation solution: 2% paraformaldehyde in PBS (see also protocol # 125), use always fresh
permeabilizations solution: 0.5% Triton X-100 in PBS, store at RT
neutralization solution: 100 mM glycin in PBS, store at 4°C
blocking solution: 1% BSA in PBS (optional - add 10% normal goat serum), store at 4°C
anti-bleaching reagent – citifluor or mowiol, store at 4°C

procedure.text: remove medium and wash cells twice with 1ml of sterile PBS (37°C)          2 x  5’

if you want to stain C2C12 cells for AChRs – add bungarotoxin                                      and incubate in the incubator (37°C)                                                                   30’                                       otherwise proceed to step 4
wash cells twice with 1ml of sterile PBS (37°C)                                           2 x  5’
remove, fix cells with 1 ml of 37°C fixative solution at RT                               10’
remove, wash fixed cells twice with 1 ml of PBS at RT                                2 x  5’

if you want to do intracellular staining then remove solution and incubate                with 1 ml of permeabilization solution at RT                                                        7’ otherwise proceed to step 7
remove, add 1 ml of neutralization solution at RT                                             15’
remove, add with 1 ml of blocking solution at RT                                          30’
remove blocking solution and add primary antibody in blocking solution                 (just to cover the cells) ~ 0.75 ml and incubate at 4°C over night                     oN
remove, wash 3 times with 1ml of blocking solution                                    3 x 10’

remove, add 1ml of secondary antibody in blocking solution                                            and incubate in dark at RT                                                                                   45’
remove, wash 3 times with 1 ml of blocking solution                                    3 x 10’
remove, dehydrate with 1 ml of 70% EtOH                                                           2’
remove, dehydrate with 1 ml of 100% EtOH                                                         2’
remove, add one drop of anti-bleaching solution on the cells
cover cells with a cover slip
observe under the microscope
store in dark at 4°C

comment: optional - duration of neutralization and permeabilization solutions can be prolonged by adding 10mNaN3
filename: ICC-cell culture-cell line staining Protocol for 35mm dish.docx

materials.text: sterile water or TE Buffer, pH 8.0

procedure.text: Cloning of the sequence into Gateway vector
Create an Entry clone with attL and attR sequence and  perform a Recombination reaction with pAd vector from Invitrogen
Add the following components to 0.5 ml microcentrifuge tubes at room
temperature and mix. Entry clone (50-150 ng/reaction) +Destination vector (300 ng/reaction) +TE Buffer, pH 8.0 to 8
Remove the LR Clonase™ II enzyme mix from -20°C and thaw on ice (~ 2 minutes)
Vortex the LR Clonase™ II enzyme mix briefly twice (2 seconds each time)
To each sample above, add 2 μl of LR Clonase™ II enzyme mix. Mix well by pipetting up and down
Incubate reactions at 25°C for 1 hour.
Add 1 μl of the Proteinase K solution to each reaction. Incubate for 10 minutes at 37°C
Transform 2-3 μl of the LR recombination reaction into a suitable E. coli host (follow the manufacturer’s instructions) and select for expression clones

materials.text: DMEM high glucose with Pyruvate with Phenol red
DMEM high glucose with Pyruvate with Phenol red

procedure.text: Splitting
Comm: C2C12 cells need to be kept at low density. Therefore split every 2-3 days (use 15 cm TC plates). A convenient way is to split them on monday, wednesday and friday.
Day: monday, wednesday; Type of plate: 15 cm TC plate; Amount of cells: 180 000
Day: friday; Type of plate: 15 cm TC plate; Amount of cells: 90 000
Day: monday, wednesday; Type of plate: 10 cm TC plate; Amount of cells: 90 000
Day: friday; Type of plate: 10 cm TC plate; Amount of cells: 45 000
Day: monday, wednesday; Type of plate: 3.5 cm TC plate; Amount of cells: 40 000
Day: friday; Type of plate: 3.5 cm TC plate; Amount of cells: 20 000
Day: monday, wednesday; Type of plate: 96 well plate; Amount of cells: 2 000 / well
Day: friday; Type of plate: 96 well plate; Amount of cells: 1 000 / well
Fusion
Comm: If the fusion of the cells is required, TC-plates should be coated with 0.03% gelatine (dilute 2 % stock 1.5/100 in H2O) for at least 30min at 37°C before plating
To induce fusion of C2C12, replace the growth medium by fusion medium when cells reach 80% confluency, usually 2 days after plating (if plated according to table )
Cells plated on monday : change to FM on wednesday - change FM on friday - ready on monday
Cells plated on wednesday : change to FM on friday - change FM on monday - ready on wednesday
Cells plated on friday : change to FM of monday - change FM on wednesday - ready on friday

title: Quantification of AChR Aggregation in cultured cells
author: Nosov G.

materials.text: Incubation medium: MEM, 10% horse serum, 100U/ml penicillin, 100μg/ml streptomycin, glutamine
Staining solution: incubation medium with 1:1000 (=1 μg/ml) rhodamine-α-bungarotoxin

procedure.text: Incubate muscle cells with agrin in incubation medium for 16h at 37°C on tissue culture dishes. (1 ml on 35mm plates)
Aspirate and wash with prewarmed MEM
Add 500μl staining solution and incubate for 45-60min at 37°C
Wash 3 times with 1-2 ml MEM and aspirate
Fix with 95% ice cold ethanol for 5min at -20°C
Aspirate ethanol and wait until the dish is dry
Mount on glass coverslip with glycerol solution (or Citifluor)
Store dishes for further AChR clustering determination at 4°C

filename: Quantification of AChR Aggregation in cultured cells Protocol.docx

title: Preparation of Ringer’s solution for rat
author: Nosov G.

procedure.text: For 1L
NaCl (7.88 g)
KCl (0.40 g)
MgCl2  (0.20 g)
CaCl2  (0.26 g)
HEPES (1.19 g)
pH (7.2 (NaOH))

filename: Preparation of Ringer’s solution for rat Protocol.docx

title: Transfection of high density primary hippocampal neuronal culture Protocol
author: Nosov G.

procedure.text: Day before transfection
Replace 50% of the medium by Neurobasalmedium without Glutamat but with P/S
Day of transfection
Combine 100 μl OptiMEM I with 4 μl of 1mg/ml Lipofectamine2000
Let at RT for 5 min
Combine 100 μl OptiMEM I with 4 μg of plasmid (ideal concentration 1mg/ml)
Let at RT for 5 min
Pour together the two solutions and mix well
Let at RT for 20 min
During the 20 min: replace the medium in the wells by 800 μl fresh Neurobasalmedium without Glutamat and without P/S
Add 200 μl LF200/DNA-mixture to the culture
After another 4 hours replace Medium. Use: Neurobasalmedium without Glutamat but with PS

filename: transfection of high density primary hippocampal neurons Protocol.docx

materials.text: medium: COS/ HEK: DMEM + 10%FCS + 1% of Pyr, Gln, P/S
PC12: DMEM + 5%FCS + 10%HoS and + 1% of Pyr, Gln, P/S

procedure.text: Comm: Cells have to be 50% confluent
aspirate medium and add 2 ml of fresh medium without antibiotics
prepare Fugene6 reagent-DNAcomplex
dilute 3-6 μl Fugene in 100 μl of serum free medium (do not allow Fugene to come	in contact with the tube)
incubate for 5min at RT
add 1-2 μg of DNA to a second sterile tube
drop wise add diluted Fugene to the tube containing the concentrated DNA
gently tap the tube to mix the contents
incubate for 30 min at RT
add transfection-mixture drop wise in the well
incubate for 24h
trypsinize myoblasts
for 1 electroporation resuspend 0.5-5.106 cells in 300 μl OPTIMEM
transfer 300 μl myoblasts in a 4 mm electroportation cuvette
add 5-20 μl DNA and mix
let stand at RT for 5 min
pulse at 350 V, 960 μF, 200 Ω (Comment τ should be 35-40)
let stand at RT for 5 min
plate

title: Freezing Cells
author: Nosov G.

materials.text: freezing medium: COS/ HEK: DMEM + 10%FCS + 1% Pyr, Gln, P/S PC12: DMEM + 5%FCS + 10%HoS and + 1% of Pyr, Gln, P/S and 10% DMSO
add DMSO at the very end of the procedure

procedure.text: aspirate medium
wash cells 2x with 1X PBS
pipette 0.5ml Trypsin/ EDTA in PBS
incubate for 3min in incubator
dissolve cells in 1.5ml medium, pipet up and down to avoid clumps
centrifuge 5min 800-1000rpm
in the meantime : add 10% DMSO to complete medium (freezing solution)
resuspend cells with 2 ml of freezing solution
divide in 2 cryotubes (1ml each), close not too tightly (optimal number of cells for freezing: 1-2*10^6 per tube
put the cryotubes immediately in a styrofoam-box at –70°C for 24h
transfer the frozen cells into liquid nitrogen.

filename: Freezing Cells Protocol for 35mm cell culture dishes.docx

title: Splitting Cells Protocol
author: Nosov G.

materials.text: COS/ HEK: DMEM + 10%FCS + 1% of Pyr, Gln, P/S
PC12: DMEM + 5%FCS + 10%HoS and + 1% of Pyr, Gln, P/S

procedure.text: aspirate medium
wash cells 2x with 1X PBS
pipette 2ml Trypsin/ EDTA in PBS (for 10cm dishes)
incubate for 3min in incubator
dissolve cells in 10ml medium, pipett up and down to avoid clumps
centrifuge 5min 1000rpm
aspirate supernatant and resuspend the pellet in complete medium (e.g. 12ml)
divide cells in the desired dilution (e.g add 3ml out of 12ml cell suspension to 9ml complete medium to achieve a 1 to 4 dilution)

comment: all solutions have to be prewarmed at 37°C

title: Transfection with Lipofectamine 2000 Protocol
author: Nosov G.

procedure.text: For cells 1ml of medium dilute 1.6μg DNA ( for siRNA I would used 40 pmol) in 100μl Opti-MEM mix gently and 4μl lipofectamine 2000 in 100μl Opti-MEM incubate for 5min
Combine both solutions and incubate for 20min at RT
Prepare cells for transfection by changing the medium to Serum Free Medium (no  antibiotics)
Add transfection mix drop wise and rock the plate back and forth
Medium should be changed after 6h
Leave 24h for expression

comment: cells have to be 50-70% confluent the day before transfection

title: Production of Lentiviral Vectors in 293T cells Protocol
author: Nosov G.

materials.text: serum-free medium (e.g. Cellgro or Episerf) or PBS / 1% BSA

procedure.text: Day 1 (Plating)
Plate 2-2.5x106 of 293T cells per 10cm plate
Day 2 (Transfection)
Prepare calcium-phosphate precipitate (1ml/10cm plate)
Add water to 0.5ml, add 0.5ml 2xHBS and mix well
Add 50μgl 2.5M CaCl2 and shake briefly
Keep in RT for 20-25min
Add dropwise on a plate and mix gently with a medium
Change medium (6-8hrs later)
Remove medium with precipitate and
Add 6ml/plate of fresh medium
Day 4 (Collection)
Collect medium
Spin 3000rpm/5min/RT
Filter through 0.45 μm (Comm: At this point virus can be used for transduction, frozen at -70°C for future use, or concentrated)
(Concentration)
Transfer 30ml of virus to 33ml Beckman conical tubes spin at 26.000rpm/2hrs/4°C in Beckman SW28 swingle bucket rotor
After spin discard supernatant and resuspend the virus in a desired volume of serum-free medium (e.g. Cellgro or Episerf) or PBS/ 1% BSA
aliquot and store at -70°C
For transduction of very delicate cells the virus can be concentrated on sucrose cushion, just put 4ml of 20% sucrose on the bottom of the tube and overlay with 26ml of viral supernatant.

filename: Production of Lentiviral Vectors in 293T cells Protocol.docx

title: Isolation and Culture of Hippocampal Neurons
author: Nosov G.

materials.text: HEPES, for stabilisation the pH at 7.35 – 238 mg/Liter

procedure.text: First Day:
The cells will seed on round coverslips in a 12 well plate (one plate per mouse).
The coverslips (CS) will cleaned in HCl, Aceton, 100% Ethanol and stored in 70% Ethanol under the bench. The cleaning protocol is in lab 01.20.
Put the coverslip with a tweezer; one coverslip per well (standing not lying). Let the Ethanol dry for at least 10min with open lid.
Add 50µl of diluted Matrigel (1:50 in DMEM, store at 4°C) in the middle of the coverslip
Fill 5 petri dish (one per mouse + one for collecting) with Hank´s+20%FCS and put them on ice
Isolate Hippocampi (HC) as customary
Divide the HCs into 4-6pieces/HC with the sharp side of the spoon or the forcep
aspirate 5ml Hank´s+20%FCS with 5ml-pipette and collect the HCs from the dish and fill them into a 15ml tube and let them settle down
aspirate the supernatant and wash them again with 5ml Hank´s+20%FCS
wash 2x with 5ml Hank´s (wo Serum) and aspirate the supernatant
add a small filter unit (red 0,2 µm Filter+5ml syringe, remove the forcer) on the top of the 15ml-tube

add 1ml Digestion solution + 10µl DNase and add to the 10mg Trypsin-Eppi 1ml Digestion Solution, when it is solved add it into the syringe. Put the forcer to the syringe and steril filtrate it directly to the HCs
Put the HCs with the Digestion solution into an Petri dish an incubate it for 15min at 37°C
fill the HCs back to a 15ml-tube with 5ml Hank´s+20%FCS
wash it 2x with Hank´s (wo serum) like describe above and aspirate the supernatant
add small filter unit to the tube and add 20µl DNase + 2ml Plating medium in the syringe – filtrate it to the HCs, adjust the amount of platingmedium to the number of wells
triturate first with Pasteur pipette with a big hole (7-10x) following with a smaller hole (3x) until there are no/less aggregates
aspirate surplus Matrigel (not too much, only 1x)
fill 50µl cell suspension in the middle of each well (and spread it with the pipette over the half of the coverslip)
Incubate it for 1h (or 2h) at 37°C and 5%CO2
add 1ml plating medium per well – back into the incubator
Next day:
Add 0,5ml growth-medium to each well
Second day:
Remove 0,5ml medium from each well and add 0,5ml growth-medium with 6µM Arac

filename: Isolation and Culture of Hippocampal Neurons Protocol.docx

materials.text: medium: COS/ HEK: DMEM + 10%FCS + 1% of Pyr, Gln, P/S
PC12: DMEM + 5%FCS + 10%HoS and + 1% of Pyr, Gln, P/S

procedure.text: for 6-well plate or 35mm Petri dish (Comment Cells have to be 50% confluent)
aspirate medium and add 2 ml of fresh medium without antibiotics
dilute 1-3 μl GenJect in 50 μl of serum free medium (do not allow GenJect to come in contact with the tube)
incubate for 10-15 min at RT
add 1 μg of DNA in 50 μl of serum free medium, mix by pipette
drop wise add diluted GenJect to the tube containing the concentrated DNA
gently tap the tube to mix the contents
incubate for 20 min at RT
add transfection-mixture drop wise in the well (for 1 ml of growth medium is added to 100 µl of suspension)
incubate for 12-24h

title: 4% Paraformaldehyde-fix (PFA) Preparation Protocol
author: Nosov G.

procedure.text: with Sodium-Phosphate
heat 250ml ddH2Oto 60°C add 48ml
add 20g PFA while stirring (UNDER THE HOOD!)
let solution cool down to RT while stirring
add 250ml 1XPBS
add 1-2 drops 1M NaOH
filtrate solution through a regular Whatman filter
check pH (pH=7.4-7.5)
store aliquots at –20°C
with Potassium-Phosphate (for neurons)
add PFA to 0.1M K-phosphate buffer (pH 7.2) to give a final concentration of 4% (w/v)
let solution cool down to RT while stirring
add sucrose to a final concentration of 11% (w/v)
filtrate solution through a regular Whatman filter
make aliquots and store them at –20°C

comment: pH check with paper; adjust with hydrogenchloride

title: Splitting and Differentiation of PC12
author: Nosov G.

materials.text: Comm: all solutions have to be prewarmed at 37°C
medium: PC12: DMEM + 5%FCS + 10%HoS and + 1% of Pyr, Gln, P/S

procedure.text: Comm: cells have to be 80% - 100% confluent
aspirate medium
wash cells 2x with PBS
pipette 2ml Trypsin/ EDTA in PBS (10cm plates)
incubate for 3min in incubator
dissolve cells in 10ml medium, pipet up and down to avoid clumps
centrifuge
aspirate supernatant and resuspend the pellet in 12ml medium
fill 9ml medium in a new 12ml Falcon tube and add 3ml of cell suspension (1:4 dilution)
fill 2ml of diluted cell suspension in a 35mm plate
incubate for 1 day (24hs)
prepare 1ml serum free medium containing 1μl NGF (100μg/ml NGF)
aspirate cell medium
wash cells 2x with serumfree medium
add 1ml serumfree medium containing 1μl NGF
observe neurite outgrowth after 1, 2, 3 days

filename: Splitting and Differenciation of PC12 Protocol.docx

procedure.text: Cover T75 cell culture flask with matrigel (2ml) and incubate at 37°C for minimum  30 min
Decapitate mouse, take out the brain and put into HBSS+20% FCS
Preparate the cortex
Cut the cortex in pieces
Transfer the pieces in a 15ml tube
Wash twice with 5ml HBSS+20%FCS (let them settle down and remove the supernatant)
Wash twice with 5ml HBSS (let them settle down and aspirate the supernatant)
Remove the buffer and incubate the pellet with 1ml trypsin/Dnase solution (10mg/ml Trypsin, 1mg/ml Dnase) in a petri-dish for 15min and 37°C
Transfer the cortex back to the 15ml and stop the digestion with HBSS/20% FCS
Cover over matrigel

materials.text: COS/ HEK: DMEM + 10%FCS + 1% of Pyr, Gln, P/S
PC12: DMEM + 5%FCS + 10%HoS and + 1% of Pyr, Gln, P/S

procedure.text: prepare a 15ml Falcon tube containing 10 ml complete medium
remove the cells from liquid nitrogen and put them into dry ice
thaw them quickly in a 37°C water bath
put cells in the 15ml Falcon containing the complete medium
centrifuge for 5min at 1000rpm
suck off the medium and resuspend the cells in 4ml fresh medium
plate the cells on two 35mm dishes

materials.text: medium: COS/ HEK: DMEM + 10%FCS + 1% of Pyr, Gln, P/S
PC12: DMEM + 5%FCS + 10%HoS and + 1% of Pyr, Gln, P/S

procedure.text: number of cells has to be 1-5 106
centrifuge 1.5ml of resuspended cells
resupend cells in 300μl serum free medium OPTIMEM
add 10-30μg DNA
incubate for 5min at RT
push in the BioRad pulser (960μF, 200Ώ, 350V, τ = 35-45)
incubate for 5min at RT
spread the solution in 4 35mm plates containing 1.5ml fresh medium
let cells recover for a few days (sometimes changing medium)
aspirate medium
add 1ml serumfree medium containing 100μg/ml NGF (1μl of stock)
wait and observe 2-4 days
